{"step_by_step_thinking": "Schizonts and late trophozoite stages of Plasmodium falciparum are not seen in peripheral blood smears because they are sequestered in the tissues. The documents mention that mature trophozoites or schizonts are usually sequestered in the tissues and not present in the peripheral blood. This sequestration is due to the ability of P. falciparum to adhere to the capillary endothelium, which is mentioned in document [11]. Therefore, the correct answer is B. Due to adherence to the capillary endothelium, they are not seen in peripheral blood.", "answer_choice": "B"}
